messages: a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:00): oh, nevermind, I just found out the guy was also using a hacked nvidia host
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:01): nvidia *corporate* host... thats balls
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:02): WET54G has the sensitivity of a KGB officer.
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:03): Anyone give me a heads up on equipment that doesn't suck ass?  -_-
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:05): wrt54gl with some hacked firmware
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:05): but its about as sensitive as a US soldier in iraq...  it might kill you and everyone in your extended family.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:08): I prefer atheros radios performance-wise, but they're damned hard to find a truely stable atheros rig without spending entirely too much money
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:09): Well I am coming from 'back in the day' when a wet11 was shit but still adequate for long haul point to point.
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:09): I need something that will run into a 24db dish and not fail completely.
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:09): It was crap but it worked... enough.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:09): well, it depends on what you're dealing with
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:10): if theres say, a canopy system 2 miles in front of your 15 mile link
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:10): it doesn't matter whatever radio you use, its not gonna work
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:10): There is no real interference to worry about.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:10): then I'd say the wrt54gl
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:11): the best thing I ever did was flip my gear into pure-g mode.
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:11): Why?  If the sensitivity was not bad enough for the linksys product, the noise issues would be enough to can it.
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:11): Meh.  The guy is running B.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:12): 802.11b dislikes multipath
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:12): of any sort
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:12): be it a tree, a building, whatever
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:12): just kills throughput
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:13): and theres not enough throughput there in the first place (to run something commercially viable)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:14): 11b has more "sensitivity" but it considers a lot more of the signal "noise" than 802.11g does in not-quite-perfect-LOS situations
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:14): Ok, I will keep that in mind when I am playing the part of 'wisp'.  Right now I am client.  I have no control over that. ;_;
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:15): Senao 2611CB3+ would be the best choice for 802.11b
13860a12a95325377fd566a38b1be13b (03:17): Ugh. 4:30pm Friday, call comes in. Customer says, "We haven't been able to load pages very well for the last 3 days."
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:19): Well 3 days and they just now get around to calling?  Does not seem that important. ;)
eaa6e1da0eef72dfb27f73d1b6493b8f (03:19): asdf
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:19): well I had a customer email me 2 days ago
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:19): asked me to check out their connection
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:20): I did, it was fine
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:20): then like 30 minutes later *poof*
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:20): they disappeared
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:20): The customer or the connection? :D
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:21): I drive by their house (its a RB112 with an AP set up on the 2nd card) and no AP talking
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:21): so I call... nobody's home
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:21): leave a message, haven't heard a peep.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:21): both the customer *and* Their connection ;)
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:22): NSA must have got him.
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:24): ...wait a moment...does this mean you lost a customer? XD
13860a12a95325377fd566a38b1be13b (03:27): Damn black helicopters. Hard enough to make a living w/o your customers being abducted.
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:28): With abductions you can at least make up the lost revenue via the selling of anal probes.
13860a12a95325377fd566a38b1be13b (03:30): No market here, too many molestors offering them free.
cf61725b58097f05f7887fd6faad390f (03:32): Your only choice is to eliminate competition.  *nod*
